fields.description:
In Confluence, when setting up a custom page to be the Home page, instead of the Activity dashboard, the user will have the page name displayed in the sidebar, so the same can quickly click on that to access the new custom page. 

When this is configured in Confluence, by clicking on Confluence's home button on the top left side of the sidebar, instead of always redirecting the user to the Home page, it will redirect the user to where the same had its last session. For example, if the user clicks on the *Activity* option in the sidebar, and then, go to a different page/part (e.g. People Directory, Settings), by clicking on the Home button, it will redirect the user to the "Activities" page.

This is a suggestion to make the Home button to always redirect the user to the custom Homepage of the site, instead of the last session (e.g. The Activities dashboard) as it can confuse people that are trying to reach the page directly.
fields.summary: Confluence Home Button Should Always Redirect the User to the Custom Homepage

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
"Working with boards" documentation some missing information about using multiple workflows on Business projects and by consequence the effects on Business board. This is an issue as using multiple workflows, or having a workflow that has two transitions from the same origin status to the same destination status would not allow the business board to be displayed. It may mislead some customers when reading the documentation.

The page in question is:

* [Working with boards|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jiracorecloud/working-with-boards-800712866.html]

h3. Suggested Solution

May I recommend then that the confluence page explicitly state that the business project board doesn’t support multiple workflows (as opposed to suggesting we “aligning [our] workflows”) under “Your project contains issues that have different workflows<https://confluence.atlassian.com/jiracorecloud/working-with-boards-800712866.html>”?

Additionally, I would also recommend that the confluence page explicitly include global transitions under “Two issue transitions go to the same status<https://confluence.atlassian.com/jiracorecloud/working-with-boards-800712866.html>”.
fields.summary: "Working with boards" Documentation update

fields.description:
Currently when starting to insert a new page link with `[` + the first few characters of a page name, the autocompletion appears and shows matching pages. Unfortunately the autocompletion dialog does not show which spaces the results are from (or it shows it as a mouse hover hint which nobody finds), so it often happens that a page from another (wrong) space is selected. This is especially a problem for huge Confluence instances with hundreds of spaces and thousands of pages.

Suggestion: show the Space next to each autocompletion result
fields.summary: Show Spaces next to Page Autocomplete Results

fields.description:
Description
Links to anchor don't work if the page title and heading are in Cyrillic.

Steps to replicate it:

Create a new page with a title and heading with Cyrillic (e.g. тестирование & тестирование heading 1, тестирование heading 2, тестирование heading 3 )
Create a new page and insert link using CTRL-K advanced link
When you click to the link it does not navigate you to the specific section

Note: it happen to anchor macro as long as the title is in Cyrillic, heading and the link from the content table built by Confluence generate weird characters from URL

The link built by Confluence has the following format:

http://[host name]/pages/ 82968577/Yes+Amplitude#YesAmplitude-%D0%92%D0%B5%D1%80%D1%81%D0%B8%D1%8F0.1%D0%92%D0%B5%D1%80%D1%81%D0%B8%D1%8F0.1

Workaround 

The only ways of the link to be working now is covert the title and heading to English but remains the content.

Note: customer reported this to be not working in latin as well.
fields.summary: Links to anchors don't work if page title and heading is in Cyrillic

fields.description:
Our use case is following: 
Somebody left the company, so their Confluence account was deactivated. 
There is a page created by this former employee. When you click the author link, you get to the profile page. And there is no indication that this user account is no longer active. This is confusing for people because they try to contact the author somehow... only to find out that this person left.

In addition, the admins have no straightforward option to delete the personal data from the profile (such as phone number). The company is not allowed to show such data to other employees after the contract ended (at least in my country).
fields.summary: Show in user profile that the account is deactivated

A page that has been recently updated and shown in the All Updates tab will disappear if it has a parent page and it's parent gets a comment.

# User A creates a child page
# User A edits the child page after a minute or two of it's creation (at this point both pages will be displayed under User's A avatar in the All Updates tab)
# User B adds a comment on the parent page

Both edits from User A (the parent and the child page) will continue to be displayed in the All Updates tab, alongside User's B comment.

h3. Summary

* Windows 10
* MacOS
* Google Chrome
* Firefox

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a page in Confluence and edit it;
# Take a screenshot of a page and copy it;
# Paste the copied image into the editor;
# Create the copy and paste it into the editor at least 3 times;
# Publish the page.

h3. Expected Results
* All images are published after editing the page.

h3. Actual Results
* Only a few images are displayed on the published page. Other images are missing from the published page.

h3. Workaround

fields.description:
h3. Summary
If you have anonymous access settled on your space, other licensed users receive that access.

Let's say you have a user on your Cloud instance which you want to only have view access in a space. After setting the proper permission, the user will still be able to edit pages and etc due to the anonymous permissions settled on the space, even if the "Use Confluence" permission is disabled at the global permissions for anonymous users.

If you remove the anonymous permissions on the space, Confluence then will respect the permissions added for the groups/users. The application acts as if anonymous permissions were valid for anyone.

h3. Environment
Cloud
Confluence 1000.0.0-4acd180b8b7

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a test user with only view permission on a space
# Add permissions for the anonymous users on the same space, like add page.
# Try to log as the test user, he will be able to edit pages, even if he only have view permission.

h3. Expected Results
Anonymous permissions must not be added for any other users/groups
h3. Actual Results
 Anonymous permissions are adding access for users which have a Confluence license.
h3.Workaround
Remove anonymous permissions.
fields.summary: Anonymous permissions on Spaces add access for licensed users

fields.description:
h3. Problem
By using the page properties macro, the performance of the Confluence page decreases proportionally to the size of the macro, taking more time to load it as long as pages are added to the results of it. Some degradations were observed when using around 4 pages of results.

Also, when nested macros with the page properties macro, the performance is decreased too.

h3. Suggestion
Increase the performance of the page properties macro to not impact the page loading time.

h3. Workarounds
None

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When having a large table in a page, it's truncated when export into PDF export.
h3. Environment
 * Confluence Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a page, add a table into the page
 # Put some contents on the table until it stretches to the maximum width
 # Save the page
 # Export the page into PDF

h3. Expected Results

Full table is showing on the PDF file.
h3. Actual Results

The table is not adjusted. Left of the table is truncated.
h3. Workaround

Manually set the maximum width of tables for the PDF export:
 # Go to *Space Tools > Look and Feel > PDF Stylesheet*
 # Edit the PDF Export Stylesheet and add these lines
{code:java}
table
{
   table-layout:auto !important;
   width: auto !important;
   max-width: 90% !important
}
{code}

Note that you would need to have space admin permission to perform the workaround.
h3. Note

If your table is copied from other content to Confluence editor, the table might contain inline style like as below:
{code:none}
<table class="wrapped fixed-table"><colgroup><col style="width: 310.0px;" /><col style="width: 304.0px;" /><col style="width: 313.0px;" /><col style="width: 349.0px;" /></colgroup>
{code}
You can verify this by "View Storage Format" and search "<table" on the page. If this is your case, unfortunately, there's no easy way to tweak the rendering glitch.
 !Screenshot 2018-04-26 11.36.21.png|thumbnail! 
 One of the ways to remove these styles is once export the page to word format and then import the word file to Confluence page. However, in many cases, you have to fix the alignment after importing the word file since these pages tend to contain complex elements.

See also [How to normalize HTML tags in page|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confkb/How+to+normalize+HTML+tags+in+page-953135631.html] for more detail.
fields.summary: Table is truncated in PDF export

fields.description:
[https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/blueprints-and-user-created-templates-724764985.html]
{quote}
h2. Create your own template 

Confluence templates exist on two levels:
 * *Global templates:* These page templates are available in every space on your site. If you have [Confluence Administrator permission|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/global-permissions-overview-724765488.html], you can create, edit, and promote global templates via the Confluence administration console. To go to the global templates page, go to *Settings* in the Confluence sidebar, then choose *Global Templates and Blueprints.*{quote}
 
 In fact, Global templates cannot be promoted under Space Settings:
 !Screen Shot 2018-03-12 at 5.11.34 PM.png|thumbnail!
Or in the Confluence Admin console:
 !AdminTemplate.png|thumbnail!

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Configuring Confluence Add-on for Stride reveals previously restricted content in Confluence
h3. Environment
 * Confluence Cloud

 * Confluence Cloud add-on for Stride 
 * Stride

 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 * install the Confluence Add-on for Stride
 * Configure it for updates and new pages to appear in Stride

 
h3. Expected Results
 * Restricted pages associated with Confluence remain restricted

h3. Actual Results

*   When restricted pages are added or updated, they will appear in Stride regardless
h3. Notes
 * Note, there was not a component for Stride or the Confluence add-on for Stride

h3. Workaround
 * Not at present

Cloud

Do not change indentation

A space is added to the left-side of the page.

None

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When creating issues by highlighting text on a table in Confluence the user is given the option to *create multiple* *issues*. If the user selects *Epic* as the issue type, it's only allowed to select one *Epic Name*, which will be applied to all Epics created.
 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # In a Confluence page, add a table and some content on it;
 # Select some text on the table and click on the *Create Jira issue* option;
 # Select *Epic* as the issue type;
 # Enter the _Epic Name_ and hit *create*. 

h3. Expected Results
 * The user should be given the option to name the Epics individually.

h3. Actual Results
 * The _Epic Name_ selected is applied to all Epics created

Workaround
 * Create Epics individually.
fields.summary: Creating Multiple Issues from Table does not allow users to set Epic Names individually

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, it's not possible to insert images into comments on the mobile app (neither android or ios).

h3. Suggested Solution
Implement the insert images into comments on the mobile apps, as it is on the mobile browser version.

h3. Workaround
Use the web version via the mobile browser.
fields.summary: Insert images into comments functionality

fields.description: We are using Sride and Confluence. We have rooms that are connected to a space but there is no link between decisions and actions in either tools.
fields.summary: Better integration of descissions and actions from confluence to Stride

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Some users may prefer to keep all e-mail notification features, but not to receive any notifications regarding page content such as:

* Page creation
* Page Edition
* Page move

h3. Suggested Solution
Allow members of the _site-admins_ group to disable these features globally.
fields.summary: Globally disable email notifications with page content

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
When users login at https://<instance>.atlassian.net/ they are directed to https://<instance>.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/<space key>/*overview?mode=global*. We would like them directed to https://<instance>.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/<space key>/*overview*. 
The global mode tends to overwhelm when customers are only using a single Space.

h3. Suggested Solution
Allow for the overview mode to be configured.

h3. Workaround
Not known.
fields.summary: Allow for overview mode configuration

fields.description:
1. It's weird that we have a loading throbber for the share dialog, no idea why
2. But either way, when you press the share button or type "s" to share, the loading throbber appears on top of the edit button.. which is really confusing because you clicked on the share button.

Seems like a regression, didn't used to do this.
fields.summary: Race condition where share dialog loading throbber appears in the wrong spot

fields.description:
Problem

We're trying to auto-generate numbers/IDs for confluence for new items and content which are centralized in one page from different sources.

Suggestion

Allow Confluence to auto-generate numbers/IDs

Workaround

None
fields.summary: Auto generate numbers/IDs for Confluence

Memory Leak in Internet Explorer 11

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# In a Windows 10 enviroment, access a Confluence site through *Internet Explorer 11*
# Open *Task Manager* to monitor Memory Usage.
# Open a Confluence Page

Memory usage should remain stable

Memory usage won't go down to the normal levels until the tab is closed.

Carlo

fields.description:
h3. Summary

If using links to create content directly from a template with the link for the creation, the same will redirect the user to an error message and then, open the editor, but, only as a blank/new page, ignoring the template content.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Being an administrator, click on the *Settings* page from the sidebar.
 # Insert any variable in the template's body.
 # Save the template
 # Now, have a user creating a new page using the template, but, instead of publishing it by filling the variables, copy the link.
 # Paste the link in a new page, so a user can click on it to create a page using the template
 # Save the page and click on the ink

h3. Expected Results

The page template should redirect the user to edit its content and be published as a page behaving as expected.
h3. Actual Results

No template is displayed. Only a blank page.
h3. Workaround
 * Copy the link URL and paste in a new tab.
 * Add a link using a relative URL instead of the absolute URL (Through *Links* on the editor. Make sure that this is a *Web* link, instead of *Advanced* link under the link properties). For example:
{code:java}
/wiki/pages/createpage-entervariables.action?templateId=<id>&spaceKey=<spaceKey>&title=&newSpaceKey=<spaceKey>
{code}
Instead of:
{code:java}
https://yours.atlassian.net/wiki/pages/createpage-entervariables.action?templateId=<id>&spaceKey=<spaceKey>&title=&newSpaceKey=<spaceKey>{code}
fields.summary: Can't Create Pages from Template in Links

Clicking on create or search in the left navigation bar does not work in an instance.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
- Access Confluence 
- Click on create (+) or search (magnifying glass) on the left navigation bar

- Create issue screen will pop up
- The search bar will be shown

- Nothing happens

- Create the page in space instead of the homepage
- for search, use this URL: <instance>/wiki/dosearchsite.action

h3. Summary

Linking to the Version of a Page (Page History) leads to a Page Not Found

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# In a page with some versions in the *Page History*, pick one - except the current - and open it.
# Copy its URL.
# Go to another page, and create a link to the URL you've copied.
# Publish the page
# Click the link

h3. Expected Results

It should lead to the page version you've linked.

h3. Actual Results

A 'Page Not Found' message is displayed.

(However, if you hit refresh (Ctrl+F5, CMD+R) or manually enter the URL at the address bar in your browser, the page loads properly)

Using confluence through a terminal session will lock up my session during the fade transition (which also gets drug out to a 5 second fade) when remoted into a pc. Each shade change seems to trigger a re-draw of the entire browser window over the terminal session.

Is there a way to disable fade animations?

The Recently Updated macro does not show results when a Space is added on the Space(s) box of the macro. 

h3. Environment
* Confluence Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
* Create a page on a Space that has pages/Spaces/content in general recently updated.
* Add the Recently Updated macro by:
** clicking { > Open macro browser > search for Recently Updated > click Recently Updated > Add a Space name on the Space(s) box > Insert.
OR
** clicking the + icon on top right of the page > Other macros > search for Recently Updated > click Recently Updated > Add a Space name on the Space(s) box > Insert.

* A list of recently updated pages and files will be shown.

h3. Actual Results

"Recently Updated
As you and your team create content this area will fill up and display the latest updates."

fields.summary: Recently Updated macro does not show results when pointing to a Space

fields.description:
h3. Summary
* When trying to create a blog post on Internet Explorer, the following error is displayed:
{quote}
Something's gone wrong. Our team has been notified. If the problem persists, please contact Atlassian Support.
{quote}

h3. Environment
* Internet Explorer version 11

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to Confluence
# Create a new blog post

h3. Expected Results
* Editor is displayed for you to create your blog post.

h3. Actual Results
* The error message of the image attached is displayed.
 
h3. Notes
* This issue seems to be related to the new editor being released to blog posts, as reported in the Atlassian's What's New page: [Atlassian Cloud changes Feb 26 to Mar 5, 2018|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/blog/2018/03/atlassian-cloud-changes-feb-26-to-mar-5-2018].

h3.Workaround
* This issue has not been reported in Firefox, therefore a workaround for this problem is to create blog posts using a different browser.

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When the cursor is inside the panel macro and you press the up or down arrow, you do not go to the previous or next line in the panel but you go out of the macro.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Add a panel macro to a page
# Populate the panel macro
# Try to navigate by using the up or down arrow

h3. Expected Results
* As tested on a previous Confluence Server version 6.5.0. Pressing the up or down arrow in a Panel macro should go to the previous or next line in the panel macro.

h3. Actual Results
* Pressing the up and down arrow in a Panel does not go to the previous or next line in the panel but you go out of the macro.
fields.summary: Navigation Issue in a Panel Macro

fields.description:
Hi there

We like Confluence a lot. We appreciate its features and hope you guys have as much fun building it as we're having using it. 

As users we'd like to change the default settings regarding the "notify watchers" feature. We forget about this regularly and everyone then get's those spam emails about minor changes on any confluence page. 

Critical changes or interesting updates to documents don't get any attention because of this rather annoying pre-defined "always on" setting. With all respect but as a user we also want to be in control - so please don't tell us why you think this is good for us or why we should feel good about this even though we want to change it anyway. 

!we want to change the default setting.png!

 

Kind regards
Stefan
fields.summary: enable users to change "notify watchers" default setting

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When entering big parts of the name of a page, the results list gets empty although there is a result shown before and the last character entered is correct to find the page still.

It was working fine before and there are some scenarios where page title contains underscore but Confluence search functionality works as expected.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a page with page title 'CLMFCT_PAYMENT_POSITION'. 
# Use Quick Search to search the title of the page


h3. Expected Results
* Quick search should work by entering keywords.

h3. Actual Results
When searching in Confluence, the page shown in the results until entering "clmfct_payment_positi". At that moment no search result is shown anymore. When entering "clmfct_payment_posit" the page is on the list.


h3. Notes
In Quick Search, if the keyword is longer than 20 characters the search will not search for that keyword e.g. clmfctpaymentpositioncheck it will stop searching when you reach "clmfctpaymentposition"
But keyword searching longer than 20 characters works for the following:

CLMFCT-PAYMENT-POSITION
CLMFCT%PAYMENT%POSITION
clmfct~payment~position

But will not work for some like: CLMFCT_PAYMENT_POSITION it will stop when you reach CLMFCT_PAYMENT_POSITI
fields.summary: [Backend] Search functionality in Confluence doesn't work as expected

fields.description:
h3. Steps to Reproduce
# In Confluence Server, create a page with a certain <span> which is set as bold in the CSS
# Export that space
# Import the space to Confluence Cloud
# Open the editor in the page containing that <span>

h3. Expected Results
* Since users can't customize CSS in Cloud, the text in <span> will be shown as normal font in both the editor and the published page

h3. Actual Results
* In the editor, text in <span> tag is shown in bold. The bold icon won't be highlighted though
* When you publish that page, text in <span> tag is shown in regular font setting
 
h3.Workaround
Clear formatting or set bold manually to the corresponding text
fields.summary: CSS is unstable in a space imported from Server

fields.description:
h3. Summary
* Old Confluence links which have the URL in the format of ADG2, https://<instance_name>.atlassian.net/wiki/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=<ID> , are not redirecting to the current URL format, https://<instance_name>.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/<space_key>/pages/<page-id> .

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Access a page that has an URL in the format https://<instance_name>.atlassian.net/wiki/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=<ID>
# Click on the link

# Create a link in a page with the format https://<instance_name>.atlassian.net/wiki/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=<ID>
# Click on the link

h3. Expected Results
* Confluence redirects the page to the current URL format, https://<instance_name>.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/<space_key>/pages/<page-id> , and the page is shown successfully.

h3. Actual Results
* Confluence goes to a "Page Not Found" page.

h3.Workaround
* If you refresh the page, it will display the page normally;
* Edit the link and insert the new URL format of the page.

h3. Notes
* This issue seems to be affecting only links that are in the content of a page. Old URL formats in headers and footers are being redirected to the new URL format as it is expected.
fields.summary: Confluence page's links with URL in ADG2 format redirect to Page Not Found

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Customers are looking for a way to navigate to the next page in a tree without the need for referencing back to the Page Tree within Confluence. 

For example, a User reads a page and is at the bottom and would like to navigate to the Next Page by clicking a "Next" button. 

h3. Suggested Solution

In a similar fashion to what we see on the Atlassian Documentation Site, include an "Up Next" macro that allows users to progress to the next page in a documentation space
 !image-2018-03-01-15-09-10-439.png|thumbnail! 
Ref: https://confluence.atlassian.com/get-started-with-confluence-cloud/before-you-start-navigate-confluence-934720153.html

h3. Workaround 
Add hard links to the next page
fields.summary: Add a Function That Allows Navigation to Next or Previous Page

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Currently, _Last modified date_ is only updated when you edit the page and published the changes. Updating a Gliffy Diagrams that are on the page without editing the page to do it will not update the _Last Modified date_.
h3. Suggested Solution

When a Gliffy Diagrams are on a page and you updated the Gliffy Diagrams, the _Last Modified date_ should change even if you did not edit the page to update the Gliffy Diagrams.  Trigger entries in the page history as well, when diagrams are changed on the page.
fields.summary: Updating Gliffy Diagrams should update Last Modified date

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When pressing up or down, the cursor  jumps out ofthe code block


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a page
# Add a code block macro
# Insert a text in the macro
# Add a new line and add another text
# Use up and down key to navigate

h3. Expected Results
Cursor goes to the next line

h3. Actual Results
Cursor jumps out of the code block
fields.summary: Unable to navigate up and down in the code block

fields.description:
So, I started with one issue, now I have three, and a little heartburn to boot.

So... I was creating a new confluence page and needed to add a URL. I had been to the page just before creating my document, so I opened by browsers back-button drop down and tried right-clicking, hoping it would give me a menu that would allow me copy the URL.  Instead, it treated the click just like a left click... That's not your problem though. Your problem is that confluence didn't pop up anything saying "Are you sure you want to leave" page – I just went, discarding all my work. Having it be super easy to lose all my work makes me want a save frequently. But, instead of having a button I can click to save change, I need to publish my document and then edit it again and find where I was.

You make it easy to lose all your work and hard to save it. I think you have that backwards.

Which brings me to issue number two. There is a feedback button on the edit page, where I typed in a message roughly matching the one above and clicked "give feedback" ... Which resulted in a forever-spinning icon (After I got sick of staring at the spinning icon, I went outside and smoked. When I returned, it still had not submitted – so I let it go for at least 10 minutes). Since I was already trying to give you grumpy feedback, having the feedback button not work made me even more grumpy.

Which brings us to issue number three. I went to report the can't-give-feedback bug. After searching for duplicate bugs, I typed up my bug report and clicked "create" only to be greeted with an insufficient permissions to assign ownership message.

If I get another similar message when I try to give this feedback, I'm going to be pretty upset.
fields.summary: Editor/Feedback Button

fields.description:
h3. Summary
The Insert link to create page functionality is not working anymore.

h3. Environment
* Confluence cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create or edit a page
# type [
# type some text
# select Insert link to create page
# Publish the page

h3. Expected Results
When clicking on the generated link, it should create a new page

h3. Actual Results
It will redirect to a blank page and begin an infinite reload loop
 
h3.Workaround
No known workaround.
fields.summary: Insert link to create page feature is not working

fields.description:
h3. Summary
* Some Confluence instances are facing performance issues with basic functionalities, such as creating/copying/moving a page, accessing Space Tools, etc.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Click on the create page button in any space.

h3. Expected Results
* The menu to select the page template loads within seconds.
* Page editor loads within a few seconds.

h3. Actual Results
* A slow response time with the menu to select the page template.
* Page editor takes more than a minute to load.

h3.Workaround
N/A
fields.summary: Confluence Cloud Performance Issues

# Add a filter to the Jira entry

h3. Expected Results
Options should be in English

h3. Actual Results

None
fields.summary: Jira filters in Activity Stream are in Chinese

fields.description:
It would be useful if users is able to review a comment before it get publish to the page. Example as below:

Once a comment is submitted, an email is sent to the "page's owner" (the page's owner would be the person who originally created the page by default or defined later by the original author), with a copy of the comment, an indication of which page was commented on, a place for a response to the comment (if an email was given) and an "Approve" "Deny" option.

If the page owner approves the comment, it is posted just like normal user comments.

If the page is denied, an email is sent back to the anonymous commenter telling them they were denied and, if a response was included, why.
fields.summary: Ability to review and approve a comment

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Can't install add-ons using the Marketplace site. 

h3. Environment
* Confluence Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
* Logged on your instance.
* On a browser, navigate to the Marketplace site: https://marketplace.atlassian.com.
* Choose an add-on for Confluence Cloud.
* Click on the Free trial button. 

h3. Expected Results
* The add-on will be installed on your instance.

h3. Actual Results
* The add-on is not installed and the following message error is shown: 
Error
We are unable to generate an evaluation license. The plugin key is invalid. Please contact us if the problem persists. 

h3.Workaround
* Install the add-on from within the instance, for example: https://<instance>.atlassian.net/wiki/plugins/servlet/upm/marketplace/featured.
fields.summary: Can't install add-ons from Marketplace

h3. Summary


Currently. confluence only able to create one decision log in a space.

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
When exporting a Confluence page to HTML, the contents of a code block macros will be converted to plain text without no color/font styling.

h3. Suggested Solution
The content of the code blocks macro should still have the styling when exporting a page to HTML.
fields.summary: HTML export should keep Code Block macro styling

fields.description:
see: [https://extranet.atlassian.com/display/MICROS/2017/06/20/atl-paas.net+is+a+new+home+for+microservices]

A symptom of using atlassian.io from the browser is issues with cookies on newer versions of Safari that cause requests to be blocked.

pf-notification-log and pf-activity (used in app-switcher) are two endpoints that have been moved away from atlassian.io to Stargate.

Their new endpoints are here, for reference:

[https://pug.jira-dev.com/gateway/api/notification-log/api/notifications/*]
[https://pug.jira-dev.com/gateway/api/activity/api/]*
fields.summary: Move confluence-frontend away from atlassian.io domain

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When the editor shortcuts are disabled at [https://cloudURL.atlassian.net/wiki/users/viewmyeditorsettings.action|https://cloudurl.atlassian.net/wiki/users/viewmyeditorsettings.action] the brackets still insert links and cannot be typed simply as brackets.
h3. Environment

Confluence Cloud, Chrome browser
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Tick the box to disable autocomplete
 # Edit a page and observe that square brackets convert to a link.

h3. Expected Results

Square brackets would not trigger special behavior in the editor and could be used as square brackets.
h3. Actual Results

Links are created when typing the square brackets into the editor.
h3. Notes
h3. Workaround

No workaround at this time.
fields.summary: Editor settings under user profile are not respected

fields.description:
We are Currently using OnPrem Jira/Confluence instance – 2000 users license. We are purchasing data center (both Jira and concfuence). We are migrating to AWS when we migrate to Data Center type of license for both Jira and Confluence require about 3 months to make the full migration and need to run both our Server and Data Center version overlapping until we finish migration to datacenter. Can we get a trial license or some other form of license to run both server and datacenter until fully migrated.

Once we are done with migration, we will decommission OnPrem instance for Jira and Confluence, we should be converting current Server type licenses to Data center type.
fields.summary: Migrating to Jira Data Center and adding Confluence Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When in incognito/private mode, overview URL with / at the end, as in https://<instance>.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/<spacekey>/overview/ 
is redirected to 
https://<instance>.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/<spacekey>/overview/index.action
h3. Environment

Confluence Cloud
h3. Steps to Reproduce

1. Open a new Chrome/Safari/Firefox on incognito/private mode.
2. Enter the URL of a instance with a / at the end, as in: 
https://<instance>.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/<spacekey>/overview/ 
3. Redirected to log in page > log in.
h3. Expected Results

Redirected to the correct URL: https://<instance>.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/<spacekey>/overview
h3. Actual Results

Redirected to https://<instance>.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/<spacekey>/overview/index.action
which displays Page Not Found error page.
h3. Workaround

Use the URL without / at the end.
fields.summary: Overview URL ending with / redirects to 404 page after logging into Confluence
